intro: Thyrsosma, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. Thyrsosma species are characterized by their compact, drought-tolerant growth habit and showy, yellow or orange composite flowers. They typically have linear, succulent leaves that help reduce water loss. The genus is well adapted to harsh environments, making them valuable for ecological restoration and ornamental gardening in dry climates.
